tasks

Class EuclideanTspTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.Task<java.util.Map<int[],java.lang.Double>>
      • tasks.EuclideanTspTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class EuclideanTspTask
extends Task<java.util.Map<int[],java.lang.Double>>
    This class represents a unit of task involved in solving a Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP), where the cities are points in the 2D Euclidean plane.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public Result<java.util.Map<int[],java.lang.Double>> execute()
        Executes the Euclidean TSP Task. The method of finding the minimal distance tour is efficient; the program will fix one point as the starting point and iterate over all the remaining permutations of the cities, and returns a permutation of least cost.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Task<java.util.Map<int[],java.lang.Double>>
        Returns:
        a map of the minimal tour among the permutations computed by this task and the cost involved for that tour. A map is used to store the minimum distance computed for each task so that it need not be re-computed each time when composing tasks.

      • main

      • splitTask

        public java.util.List<Task<java.util.Map<int[],java.lang.Double>>> splitTask()
